questions.question: Who received Ramanujan’s first letter in England?
questions.answer: Hardy

questions.question: What profession did Ramanujan follow in Madras?
questions.answer: Clerk

questions.question: Which mathematician worked closely with Hardy?
questions.answer: Littlewood

questions.question: Why did Hardy first think the manuscript was a fraud?
questions.answer: No proofs were given

questions.question: What game did Hardy play after lunch?
questions.answer: Real tennis

questions.question: Where did Ramanujan come from?
questions.answer: Madras

questions.question: Which goddess did Ramanujan’s mother believe in?
questions.answer: Namakkal goddess

questions.question: In which year did Ramanujan reach England?
Which society elected Ramanujan as a Fellow?
questions.answer: Royal Society

questions.question: What illness caused Ramanujan’s death?
questions.answer: Tuberculosis

questions.question: In which year did Ramanujan reach England?
Which society elected Ramanujan as a Fellow?
questions.answer: Royal Society

questions.question: What illness caused Ramanujan’s death?
questions.answer: Tuberculosis

questions.question: Why did Hardy feel bored when he first saw Ramanujan’s letter?
questions.answer: Because the manuscript looked strange and had no proofs.

questions.question: What made Hardy rethink his opinion about the manuscript?
questions.answer: The originality of the theorems kept troubling his mind.

questions.question: Who was Littlewood?
questions.answer: He was an English mathematician and Hardy’s colleague.

questions.question: Why was Ramanujan’s mother against his travel to England?
questions.answer: She believed crossing the sea was against religious customs.

questions.question: How did Ramanujan’s mother change her decision?
questions.answer: She had a dream in which the goddess permitted the journey.

questions.question: Why could Ramanujan not enter Madras University?
questions.answer: He could not pass English in matriculation.

questions.question: What kind of mathematician was Ramanujan?
questions.answer: He was a self-taught mathematical genius.

questions.question: Why did Hardy have to teach Ramanujan formal mathematics?
questions.answer: Ramanujan lacked training in modern mathematical methods.

questions.question: What is special about the number 1729?
questions.answer: It is the smallest number expressible as the sum of two cubes in two ways.

questions.question: What honours did Ramanujan receive in England?
questions.answer: He became a Fellow of the Royal Society and Trinity College.
